result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Ruelas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Ruelas appeared by video.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas appeared by video for Daniel Ruelas.  Attorney Patrick Franken appeared in court on behalf of Abby Rockendorf for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel provides an update to the court, and requests a PGP date. Court calendars the next court date for a Plea/Sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-19-22

Defendant Daniel Ruelas appeared by video.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas appeared by video for Daniel Ruelas.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel requests an additional status conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Further, parties are still in negotiations and are requesting an additional status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-8-22
Received and Signed. Interpreter Request
Received and Filed. Amended Interpreter request for Defendant and proposed order.
Received and Filed. Interpreter request for Defendant and proposed order.

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court. Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant appears without counsel, but advises the Court that he has retained Attorney Ronnie Vargas. Court sets next court date for a Status Conference date and advises parties that a notice of retainer is needed. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-4-22

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court.  John J Rejowski appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status of Counsel. Court is advised that the defendant still has yet to be represented in this court matter. Defendant informs court that he is still waiting to hear responses from the various attorneys he has contacted. Further, the defendant has been in contact with his agent regarding the possibility of SPD eligibility. Court sets an additional Status of Counsel date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-31-22

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court without counsel.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Indigency hearing.  The indigency hearing was held in person.  The court held a colloquy with the defendant,he is awaiting response from the Attorney's he contacted.  The court instructed him to follow up with the Attorney's he contacted.  The court adjourned the matter back to Branch 16 for Status of Counsel in person.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-8-22

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court without counsel..  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Indigency Hearing.  Defendant appeared outside court, but court was by zoom.  Court does not have time for an idigency hearing before preliminary hearing.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 3-1-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Daniel Ruelas in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Daniel Ruelas in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
